publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4962 Dr Jean Turner: BackCare Awareness Week, 16 to 21 October 2006â€”That the Parliament commends all organisations involved in supporting people who develop and live with back pain, including BackCare which organises the annual health awareness campaign to ensure that the nation has healthy backs; recognises that two out of five adults will develop back pain in the next twelve months, costing businesses money in terms of days lost off work and costing the NHS a large portion of its budget for prescription painkillers and often for anti-depressants; further recognises that some sufferers may require to be reassessed by chronic pain clinicians; encourages employers to complete display screen equipment (DSE) checks on computer equipment and chairs for users who can frequently develop back complaints, and encourages everyone to develop and maintain good posture at all times to alleviate potential future back problems. Supported by: Christine Grahame*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Tommy Sheridan*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Stewart Stevenson*, John Swinburne*, Ms Maureen Watt*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Rob Gibson*, Chris Ballance*, Shiona Baird*
S2M-4962 BackCare Awareness Week, 16 to 21 October 2006 (lodged on 17 October 2006) Pauline McNeill*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Frances Curran*
S2M-4962 BackCare Awareness Week, 16 to 21 October 2006 (lodged on 17 October 2006) Carolyn Leckie*, Mrs Nanette Milne*
S2M-4962 BackCare Awareness Week, 16 to 21 October 2006 (lodged on 17 October 2006) Donald Gorrie*
S2M-4962 BackCare Awareness Week, 16 to 21 October 2006 (lodged on 17 October 2006) Mr Kenneth Macintosh*
S2M-4962 BackCare Awareness Week, 16 to 21 October 2006 (lodged on 17 October 2006) Eleanor Scott*
